surrogates.bibl: Colour images made for the Codex Zacynthius project

listBibl.bibl: S.P. Tregelles, Codex Zacynthius, London: Bagster and Sons, 1861 (full transcription)
J. Harold Greenlee, “A Corrected Collation of Codex Zacynthius (Cod. Ξ)” JBL 76.3 (1957) 237–41 (list of corrections to Tregelles)

H.A.G. Houghton, Panagiotis Manafis and Amy Myshrall (ed.), The Palimpsest Catena of Codex Zacynthius: Text and Translation (Texts and Studies 3.22). Piscataway NJ: Gorgias, 2020. ISBN: 978-1-4632-4105-6

projectDesc.p: This transcription was made by the Codex Zacynthius Project in 2018 from multispectral digital images, and corrected in 2019 for publication in a digital edition. It was created using the Online Transcription Editor produced by the Workspace for Collaborative Editing.
The transcription was thoroughly revised in June 2020 to correspond to the printed edition detailed above.

editorialDecl.p: This transcription covers all surviving pages of the undertext. The transcription includes foliation, lineation, all punctuation and abbreviations. The transcription was made from fresh multispectral digital images produced for the Codex Zacynthius project. These images are available online alongside the edition at (see also ) It was compared with the edition of Tregelles and corrections of Greenlee (see above), and differences are indicated in editorial notes.
The XML specifications used are version 1.5 of the IGNTP Guidelines available at

revisionDesc.change: First edition of the transcription (last changed 21st January 2020) updated with reference to the printed edition text by Hugh Houghton. cap2, cap3 and cap4 made cap style="2" etc.

ab.note: It is possible that the first two letters of αναταξασθαι are at the end of the previous line, but we have followed Tregelles' reconstruction.
Tregelles suggests an erased και at the end of this line but neither Greenlee nor we see this.

fw.note: Section number αι should be ια.

ab.note: Tregelles read ενωπιον but the images show the base of α as the third letter.
Tregelles breaks word at λαλη-σαι.
Tregelles has εωρακεν here, with no correction in Greenlee.
One or more pages missing
One or more pages missing
Beginning of verse missing.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles: F12r obscure. The line ριαμμεγαλυνειηψυχημου is in the MS, though very illegible.
The section number μϛ should be με.
Tregelles erroneously has με for εμε, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles incorrectly records section number νβ as νγ above line.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles states that εν is gone but we can see traces of ε.
Tregelles states that the termination of επεσκεψατ- is lost but we and Greenlee see traces of ο.

Tregelles: F15v, the head line of the first κεφαλαιον stands below a portion of the Catena, just above the Text. Α in the left hand margin, to note the commencement of the first κεφαλαιον, if it ever was there, seems now to be buried beneath the upper writing.

seg.note: The underline and the base of α can be seen in the gutter, although Tregelles could not make it out.

ab.note: Tregelles expresses uncertainty about this word but it is clearly κυρινιου (thus also Greenlee).

seg.note: Tregelles misinterprets the decoration under the Vatican paragraph number as the catena section number π, which cannot be seen in the biblical text on this or the previous page.

ab.note: One or more pages missing
Tregelles claims that in the margins of F19r and 19v the section ΙΑ is noted, but has been erased; we do not see it on either page.

seg.note: Tregelles believed that Vatican number ιη could be seen in the margin, but it is not visible on any images available to us.

ab.note: Tregelles has τη at beginning of next line.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles says: The notation ΠΖ of the Catenary section appears to be in the margin by the side of Δ, but we cannot see it. Also, Tregelles has αννης της in chapter title but it is αννας της.
Tregelles has Ναζαρεθ, corrected by Greenlee.
One or more pages missing

Tregelles notes that on F23v and F24r the κεφαλαιον Ϛ stands marked as if it began in the middle of 3.7, and in the other at the beginning of v.14. It is commonly marked at the beginning of v.10, a part defective in Cod. Zacynthius.
One or more pages missing
The μου˙ projects into the right margin and may be a later addition, perhaps by the original copyist.
Several pages missing
One or more pages missing
Tregelles has αρουσιν, corrected by Greenlee.

fw.note: According to Tregelles, the Vatican Number κη is just visible.

ab.note: One or more pages missing.
Upsilon tagged as lacunose by Tregelles, but part of the letter is clearly visible.
Kappa tagged as lacunose by Tregelles but part of letter is clearly visible.
Tregelles has εξηλθ[ ]; like Greenlee, we can see more.
Tregelles has πνευμασι̅, but Greenlee corrects to πνευμασι.
Greenlee notes that the second omicron looks like a theta, but does not identify it as a correction.
Query whether diaeresis or breathing mark are visible above υιος - currently hidden in gutter.
One or more pages missing

fw.note: Tregelles suggests the heading has been erased; it is very difficult to make out on the images. Nevertheless, there do seem to be several letters in the very top margin (including κου just to the left of the pencil page number), which suggest that it may have been written by a later hand.

ab.note: Tregelles has line break as βλασ-φημιας

fw.note: Tregelles states that the titlos is partly erased; although he has του τελωνην it is τον τελωνην.

ab.note: Tregelles gives a Greek Ano Teleia
One or more pages missing
Tregelles has μισησωσιν, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.
Greenlee suggests that the tau at the end of the penultimate line was erased by the first hand. Tregelles does not record it.
Tregelles: εχρους, sic. not εχθρους.

seg.note: Most of this section number is in the gutter, and it is not entirely clear that it reads οϛ.

ab.note: Tregelles breaks σιαγονα at σια-γονα.
ab.w:
κωλυ
Tregelles claims that the Vatican Number ΜΖ has been erased in the margin, but it is not visible on our images.
σης

ab.note: Tregelles has line break at αγα-πωσιν.
Tregelles has δανειζουσιν, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.
Tregelles has καρφος, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.

Tregelles and Greenlee note the repetition of this line. The latter writes "There is a possibility that this repetition includes one previous line. If so, it is probably εκβαλε πρωτον την δο. I would be happy if some qualified person would examine the MS ... and give his opinion." We see no such line and think the repetition is accidental.
The upsilon is inside the omicron
Tregelles has εστιν and Greenlee has εστιιν (sic) here but it is clearly εστην.
Tregelles incorrectly has a small displaced τας after εις, which Greenlee was also unable to see.
The first hand began to write η on the line above, then erased it and started the biblical text one line lower.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles: γ added smaller above the line.
Tregelles says ΝΓ in the left hand margin apparently erased, as also is Κ before line 10, but we do not see either.
Tregelles has chapter number κ here but we read this as section number ϙγ, with chapter number κ two lines above.
Tregelles has αυτη δε. Greenlee does not notice this error.
Tregelles has εχαρισα-το βλεπειν, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.

Tregelles has ημφιε-σμενον but Greenlee has ημφιι̣-σμενον and states that the last two letters of the line are almost certainly not ιε. This may be confirmed by the angle of the descenders, and we have recorded the letter as lacunose because of a hole in the parchment.
Tregelles: τριφη thus, not τρυφη.
Tregelles omits this page.
Tregelles has αρτον and Greenlee has αρτο (?). There is a final nu overline here - it is small and in line with the top of the omicron.

seg.note: Tregelles says that + before ΝϚ is almost entirely cut off; a small remnant shows that it was there. However, the visible part of the ink may be a small ϛ, indicating that νϛ was originally written in a smaller hand before the page was trimmed and the number was re-added later on.

ab.note: Τhe rest of the verse is missing.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles πεντηκοντα, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles: F52r, the notation ΙΗ and ΙΘ in the margin very faintly traceable.

Tregelles records the section number ιθ in the column left margin but Ι can't see it and no catena on this page is numbered ιθ. Note, however, the catena and section number ιθ on next page F52v, not recorded by Tregelles.
Tregelles has τελεσφορουσιν (no final nu overline).
One or more pages missing
Tregelles απο του ανθρωπου, but we agree with Greenlee's correction.
Tregelles notes that the ο of οτι has been erased but it is quite clear.
We cannot see the traces of the first four letters of απελθειν on the new images, even though the spacing suggests that it should be here and Tregelles has transcribed it.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles omits this first line of text.
Tregelles has απ corrected to υπ. With Greenlee, we see only υπ, no correction.
Tregelles has a second line on this page: αρνουμενων δε παντων, repeated on F58r. However, the line only appears once: on F58r and not on this page.
Tregelles has συν-νεχουσιν across lines 3 and 4. He suggests that the nu at the beginning of line 4 has been erased. We agree with Greenlee in reading συνεχουσιν without correction.
Tregelles has ε-ξελθουσαν.
One or more pages missing
VaticanNumber in right page margin has been cut off, only the + remains.
Tregelles has section number ν here.
Tregelles has μη-τε.
Tregelles has εχειν, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles has the VaticanNumber ξε here but we cannot see it. It is, however, on preceding page, not noted by Tregelles.
Tregelles has κατεκλασε̅ (final nu overline).
VaticanNumber ΞΘ in page left margin may have a + before it that has been cut off.
Tregelles includes η between απολεσας and ζημιωθεις, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles gives αν, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles gives the abbreviated form of υιος.
Initial letter ε is highly decorated, much like the ε at Luke 1:1.
Tregelles has word break at προσευ-ξασθαι.
Tregelles omits this page.
One or more pages missing
Tregelles has ειδον, Greenlee corrects to ειδαν.
One or more pages missing
One or more pages missing
Tregelles has final nu overline here.
Tregelles was not sure whether o was present or not. We think we can detect ink that might be part of the upper right quadrant of an ο. This shows up better on 111-r_cor_RLE_004.jpg.

seg.note: Tregelles appears erroneously to have this Vatican paragraph on 73v rather than 73r, although he says on that page that they are faint, whereas here they are more conspicuous.
Tregelles appears erroneously to have this Vatican paragraph on 73v rather than 73r, although he says on that page that they are faint, whereas here they are more conspicuous.

ab.note: We believe that the Vatican Paragraphs which Tregelles marks on this page are actually on the previous page (73r).
Tregelles notes that line 4 is very obscure at the end, but κε does not appear to have been there.
Tregelles has εχουσιν, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles has ιησους in full.
Tregelles has επ at end of line 5, but the π at the beginning of the line is clearly visible on our images.
Tregelles has ετερους.
Tregelles has ημελλεν, but there appears to be a trace of ink at the bottom of the letter which supports ε-.
Tregelles has this word broken over two lines υπα-γετε but it is not broken.

seg.note: Tregelles: Line 7, πζ in the margin, hardly traceable.

ab.note: Tregelles has τυρω on one line.
Tregelles has an apostrophe instead of a high dot.

fw.note: This number is written several lines higher up than the biblical text to which it refers.

ab.note: One or more pages missing

seg.note: Tregelles believes that the Vatican number +οη was in the margin here, but it is not visible on any images available to us.

ab.note: Tregelles correctly has σοι. Greenlee claims that it is σε̣ and 'definitely not σοι'.
Tregelles has ισχυι on line above without word break.
Tregelles has κατεβαινον, corrected by Greenlee.
Tregelles mistakenly calls F83r obscure, but he presumably means this page.
Line 1: Tregelles has σαμαρειτης, Greenlee corrects to σαμαριτης but we think it is σαμαρητης.
There is not enough space for κατα αυτον here. The remaining letters are very unclear.
Tregelles has ελεον which Greenlee corrects to ελαιον.
Tregelles is missing the last three letters (ται), corrected by Greenlee.
One or more pages missing
One or more pages missing
One or more pages missing
Tregelles has επαρασα here, suggesting that the final α has been added, smaller, but with Greenlee, we see no evidence of this.
